definition: abbr. for Macao 澳門|澳门/abbr. for Australia 澳大利亞|澳大利亚

sentences.english: When he heard about the devastating earthquake in Haiti, he was at the Australian Open.
sentences.chinese: 海地毀滅性地震傳到他的耳裏，他還在澳網中搏殺。

sentences.english: The result was emphatic victories at the Australian Open, Wimbledon and U.S. Open.
sentences.chinese: 最後結果是他贏得了澳網，溫布頓和美網。

sentences.english: For whatever reason, something about the Australian Open seems to disagree with Venus.
sentences.chinese: 不知爲何，大威對澳網似乎變現得有些“水土不服”。

sentences.english: He got you good in Masters Cup, outlasted you in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾在大師杯，澳網上打敗你。

sentences.english: Maybe for next year I will skip that week just in case.
sentences.chinese: 也許來年我應該在澳網前那周不參賽。

sentences.english: Ljubicic saw me get in and said that he did it at the Australian Open.
sentences.chinese: 柳比西奇看到我在弄，說他澳網上也洗過的。

sentences.english: The tournament was played on Rebound Ace for the first time in Australian open tennis history.
sentences.chinese: 在澳網史上，聯賽第一次在硬地球場舉行。

definition: to win every trick in a card game/grand slam/fig. total success
Wimbledon Championships (tennis)/abbr. for 溫布爾登網球公開賽|温布尔登网球公开赛[Wen1 bu4 er3 deng1 Wang3 qiu2 Gong1 kai1 sai4]
the net of justice/rigorous process of the law/the long arm of the law
to mess sth up/to screw up
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
Vanuatu, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean
